content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find the GitHub Skill section and how many courses are under the 'First day on GitHub' heading.  Please interact with https://github.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to find the GitHub Skill section, which is likely under a "Resources" or similar menu. The "Resources" button [6] in the navigation menu could lead to education or skill-related content. I should explore it first.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Learning Pathways" option [12] under the "Resources" menu most likely leads to GitHub skill-building or educational content, potentially including the "GitHub Skill" section. I should click on it to proceed.
Action: Click [12]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have reached the "GitHub Learning Pathways" page, which likely contains the "GitHub Skill" section and relevant course information. The cookie consent message at the bottom is covering some of the page, so I'll accept it to ensure full visibility of content.
Action: Click [11]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am on the "GitHub Learning Pathways" page, but only the header and introductory text are visible. To find the "GitHub Skill" section and the "First day on GitHub" courses, I need to scroll down and view more of the page.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see a section called "Pick your pathway" with several pathway options, but I do not see the "GitHub Skill" section or the "First day on GitHub" heading yet. I need to scroll further down the page to find these sections.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current view provides more information about the available learning pathways and links to explore each, but there is still no indication of a "GitHub Skill" section or a "First day on GitHub" heading. I need to continue scrolling down to find these specific sections.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This section features testimonials and expert insights but still does not display the "GitHub Skill" section or the "First day on GitHub" heading. I need to continue scrolling down to access more content and find the required sections.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page is still displaying testimonials and company logos. There is no sign of the "GitHub Skill" section or the "First day on GitHub" heading yet. I need to continue scrolling down to find these sections.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.62
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have reached the "GitHub Learning Pathways" section, which introduces learning materials and tutorials that may include the "GitHub Skill" section. To find the actual skill sections or courses, I need to scroll further down to reach the specific details, such as "First day on GitHub."
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have reached a section that talks about optimizing GitHub use through expert insight. However, I still do not see the "GitHub Skill" section or the "First day on GitHub" heading. I need to continue scrolling down to find the relevant skill courses and headings.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have reached the end of the main content on this page, and there is a call-to-action button labeled "Start your learning pathway." The footer appears next, which means there is no further content below. I have not found a section explicitly named "GitHub Skill" nor the "First day on GitHub" heading and course count. The likely next step is to click "Start your learning pathway" [8] to see if it leads to the specific skill sections and course listings I need.
Action: Click [8]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This section shows several pathways or courses, like "AI-powered development with GitHub Copilot" and "CI/CD with GitHub Actions," but I do not see the "First day on GitHub" heading yet. I need to scroll down further to locate the correct section and the exact number of courses under it.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still do not see the "First day on GitHub" heading or course list; the current view focuses on exploration of specific learning pathways. Since I've already scrolled past this section before, it's possible the section I need is above these pathway options. I should scroll back up to check if I missed the "First day on GitHub" heading and course count earlier.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Scrolling up did not reveal the "First day on GitHub" heading or the "GitHub Skill" section either. I am still within the same "Pick your pathway" area. Since neither up nor further down has shown the required section, I should try exploring the "Learn" menu to see if it leads to more focused GitHub skill sections or introductory courses.
Action: Click [4]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.88
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Learn" dropdown menu is open, showing options for "GitHub Learning Pathways," "Documentation," and "GitHub Certifications." "GitHub Learning Pathways" is the most likely section to host the "First day on GitHub" courses and a dedicated skills section. I should select it to see if it leads directly to more focused introductory skill content.
Action: Click [7]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am at the top of the "GitHub Learning Pathways" page. To locate the "GitHub Skill" section and specifically the "First day on GitHub" heading and its courses, I need to scroll down and search for these details within the pathways content.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.92
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Pick your pathway" section is visible, listing several pathways, but there is still no sign of the "First day on GitHub" section or a GitHub Skill-specific section. I should continue scrolling down as introductory courses are likely further down in the list.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.93

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[1]: "Resources", "GitHub resources homepage";	[2]: <button> "Why GitHub", "Show the Why GitHub dropdown menu";	[3]: <button> "Topics", "Show the Topics dropdown menu";	[4]: <button> "Learn", "Show the Learn dropdown menu";	[5]: <button> "Events & Webinars", "Show the Events & Webinars dropdown menu";	[6]: "Enterprise trial";	[7]: "Contact Sales";	[8]: "Explore your GitHub Copilot learning pathway";	[9]: "Explore your automation learning pathway";	[10]: "Explore your security learning pathway";	[11]: "Explore your administration learning pathway";

content:

The section labeled "Featuring expert insights from:" is just beginning to appear. I should keep scrolling down to try to locate the sought-after introductory section.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
